page_content:
ANEETA - Agents for National Eligibility Entrance Test Assistance
ANEETA (Agents for National Eligibility Entrance Test Assistance) is a comprehensive multi-agent
system tailored to support NEET-UG aspirants in their preparation journey. Developed with a vision
to empower underprivileged and underserved students, ANEETA delivers high-quality, accessible,
and multilingual NEET training, all while running entirely offline on local hardware.
System Overview:
ANEETA leverages local LLMs (Gemma 3n via Ollama) and is designed as part of the Kaggle x
Google - The Gemma 3n Impact Challenge by Jim Harrington and Jabin Joshua.
The system comprises the following intelligent agents:
- Mentor Agent: Provides general guidance to candidates, including creating awareness about the
exam, helping identify high-priority topics, and offering preparation strategies.
- Teacher Agent: Answers subject-specific questions in Biology, Physics, and Chemistry using the

- Teacher Agent: Answers subject-specific questions in Biology, Physics, and Chemistry using the
official NCERT textbooks as its primary reference source, ensuring curriculum alignment.
- Doubt Solver Agent: Specializes in solving MCQs from past NEET papers. It offers detailed
explanations to help students understand the logic behind each answer.
- Trainer Agent: Utilizes a curated three-year solved NEET question bank to craft custom quizzes
based on user-selected topics. It explains solutions thoroughly and adapts responses to support
deep understanding.
Multilingual Support:
All responses are available in English and translated into major regional languages:
- Tamil
- Hindi
- Bengali
- Telugu

ANEETA - Agents for National Eligibility Entrance Test Assistance
- Marathi
Key Highlights:
- Fully local deployment: No internet required
- Powered by Gemma 3n via Ollama
- Designed for equity and inclusion in education
- Focused on NEET UG, India's premier medical entrance exam
Learn more or contribute:
https://github.com/jimdatapro/ANEETA

NEET  2026  -  An  Overview   The  NEET  (UG)  Examination  is  a  pre-medical  entrance  test  for  students  aspiring  to  secure  admission  in  
undergraduate
 
medical
 
programs
 
at
 
government,
 
private
 
colleges,
 
and
 
international
 
institutions.
 
NEET
 
(UG)
 
stands
 
for
 
the
 
National
 
Eligibility
 
cum
 
Entrance
 
Test
 
(Undergraduate).
 
It
 
is
 
conducted
 
by
 
the
 
National
 
Testing
 
Agency
 
(NTA)
 
every
 
year.
  Particulars Details  
Examination  Name  National  Eligibility  cum  Entrance  Test  
Examination  Organising  Body  National  Testing  Agency  (Since,  2019)  
Official  Website(s)  ●  nta.ac.in/  ●  neet.nta.nic.in/  
Qualification  Eligibility  12th  passed  with  Physics,  Chemistry,  Biology  
Minimum  Age  Criteria  17  years  
Examination  Date  May  2026  
Examination  Mode  Pen  and  Paper  
Frequency  of  Examination  Once  in  a  year

Eligibility  Criteria   Below  is  an  overview  of  eligibility  criteria  to  attempt  NEET(UG)  2026.   Academic  Qualification  10+2  or  its  equivalent  with  Physics,  Chemistry,  and  Biology.  
NEET  Eligibility  Marks  General  Category  –  50%  (PH  –  45%)   OBC/SC/ST  –  40%  (PH  –  40%)   Note:  Mathematics  scores  are  not  considered  for  this  examination.  
Age  Limit  Minimum:  17  Years  Age  Maximum:  No  upper  age  limit  
Number  of  Attempts  No  restrictions  on  the  number  of  attempts.  
Nationality  Indian  Nationals   NRIs,  OCIs,  PIOs  &  Foreign  Nationals

Application  Form   Registration  Process  For  the  2026  exam,  the  registration  for  NEET  is  available  from  December-January  2026.  NEET  2026  
registration
 
date
 
will
 
be
 
announced
 
in
 
the
 
official
 
bulletin
 
released
 
by
 
NTA.
 Information  about  the  NEET  registration  form  will  be  disclosed  in  the  notification  of  NTA  for  NEET  UG  
2026.
 
However,
 
once
 
the
 
registration
 
process
 
starts,
 
here
 
is
 
a
 
step-by-step
 
guide
 
to
 
registering
 
for
 
NEET
 
UG
 
2026.
  ●  Visit  the  official  website.   ●  Click  on  the  registration  form  link  given  on  the  homepage   ●  Click  on  New  Registration   ●  Enter  your  basic  details  such  as,  name,  mobile  number,  and  email  address  etc.,  and  click  on  
submit
 
button.

metadata.creator: PyPDF
metadata.title: All-in-One NEET 2025 Guide: From Syllabus to Strategy

page_content:
submit
 
button.
  ●  Enter  the  received  OTP  &  get  registered.   ●  Once  registered,  login  using  your  application  number  and  password.   ●  Fill  out  the  application  form  and  upload  the  necessary  documents.   ●  Save,  submit,  and  pay  the  fees.   ●  Download  the  application  form  for  future  reference.   Documents  Required  for  NEET  UG  Registration  Applicants  must  ensure  their  possession  of  the  required  documents  both  in  physical  (hard  copy)  and  
digital
 
(soft
 
copy)
 
formats:
 
Below
 
are
 
the
 
list
 
of
 
documents
 
necessary
 
for
 
the
 
registration
 
purpose:
  ●  Class  10th  and  12th  Marksheet  ●  Class  10th  and  12th  Passing  Certificate  ●  Aadhar  Card  ●  Scanned  pictures  of  Finger  impressions  ●  Signature  ●  Photograph  ●  Valid  ID  proof  ●  Category  certificate  (if  applicable)  ●  Domicile  Certificate

Exam  Pattern
 The  NEET  2026  exam  will  be  conducted  in  2  phases  in  Hybrid  mode.  The  paper  pattern  for  the  NEET  
exam
 
comprises
 
three
 
subjects:
 
Physics,
 
Chemistry,
 
and
 
Biology.
 
In
 
the
 
latest
 
notification
 
on
 
25
 
January,
 
NTA
 
informed
 
all
 
NEET
 
UG
 
2026
 
aspirants
 
that
 
the
 
question
 
paper
 
pattern
 
and
 
examination
 
duration
 
will
 
revert
 
to
 
the
 
pre-COVID
 
format.
 
In
 
this
 
pre-COVID
 
format,
 
there
 
will
 
no
 
longer
 
be
 
any
 
Section
 
B.
 
Hence,
 
there
 
will
 
be
 
180
 
compulsory
 
questions
 
(45
 
questions
 
each
 
in
 
Physics
 
and
 
Chemistry
 
and
 
90

  Below  is  an  overview  of  the  Exam  pattern  for  NEET  2026   Mode  of  Exam  Hybrid  Mode  and  exam  will  be  Conducted  in  Two  Phases  
Duration  and  Timing  Duration:  3  hours  Timing:  2:00  PM  to  05:00  PM  
Number  of  Questions  180  
Type  of  Question  Multiple  Choice  Questions  (MCQs)  
Number  of  Questions  in  each  Subject  Physics  (45),  Chemistry  (45),  Biology  (90)

metadata.creator: PyPDF
metadata.title: All-in-One NEET 2025 Guide: From Syllabus to Strategy

page_content:
Total  Marks  720  Marks  
Marking  Scheme  Correct  Answer:  +4  marks  Incorrect  Answer:  -1  mark  
Languages  13  Languages   Marking  Scheme:  ●  Each  question  is  worth  4  marks.  ●  Choosing  the  correct  or  most  suitable  answer:  +4  marks.  ●  Marking  an  incorrect  option:  -1  mark.  ●   Leaving  a  question  unanswered:  0  marks.  ●  When  multiple  options  are  correct,  +4  marks  are  awarded  to  those  who  choose  any  of  the  correct  
options.
 ●   If  all  options  are  correct,  +4  marks  are  given  to  all  who  attempt  the  question.  ●  If  none  of  the  options  is  correct,  a  question  is  wrong,  or  it's  dropped,  all  candidates  receive  +4  
marks,
 
regardless
 
of
 
whether
 
they
 
attempted
 
the
 
question.
  
Chapterwise  Weightage  The  NEET  exam  features  a  chapter-wise  weightage  system,  crucial  for  students  to  understand  the  
significance
 
of
 
each
 
chapter
 
in
 
Biology,
 
Chemistry,
 
and
 
Physics.

 Admit  Card   The  NEET  admit  card  is  a  crucial  document  for  exam  takers,  serving  as  an  entry  pass  to  the  examination  hall  and  
containing
 
vital
 
information
 
about
 
the
 
candidate
 
and
 
the
 
examination.
 
Based
 
on
 
past
 
year
 
trends,
 
NEET
 
2026
 
Admit
 
card
 
will
 
be
 
released
 
tentatively
 
in
 
April
 
2026.
  NEET  2026  Exam  Date  May  2026  
NEET  2026  Admit  Card  Official  Website(s)  nta.ac.in/  and  neet.nta.nic.in/ 
NEET  Admit  Card  2026  Release  Date                May  2026  
Admit  Card  2026  issuing  authority  National  Test  Agency  (NTA)  
Login  Requirements  for  NEET  2026  Admit  Card

metadata.creator: PyPDF
metadata.title: All-in-One NEET 2025 Guide: From Syllabus to Strategy

page_content:
Admit  Card  2026  issuing  authority  National  Test  Agency  (NTA)  
Login  Requirements  for  NEET  2026  Admit  Card  
●  NEET  Application  number  ●  Date  of  birth  ●  Security  pin   How  to  Download  NEET  2026  Admit  Card?  To  obtain  the  NEET  2026   admit  card  when  it  becomes  accessible,  follow  the  stepwise  instructions  below.   ●  Visit  the  NTA  official  website.  ●  Click  on  the  NEET  2026  admit  card  link  when  available.  ●  Enter  your  application  number,  date  of  birth,  and  security  pin,  then  click  "Submit."  ●  NEET  2026  admit  card  will  appear  on  the  screen.  ●  Verify  the  information  on  your  admit  card  for  correctness.  Report  any  discrepancies  immediately.  ●  Download  the  NEET  admit  card  and  make  3-4  printouts  for  future  use.  ●  Ensure  your  parent's  signature  in  the  designated  space  on  the  NEET  2026  admit  card.

metadata.creator: PyPDF
metadata.title: All-in-One NEET 2025 Guide: From Syllabus to Strategy

page_content:
Download  NEET  2026  Admit  Card  Offline  Candidates  can  readily  download  the  Admit  card  from  the  nearest  Common  Services  Center  (CSC)  if  they  are  
unable
 
to
 
access
 
the
 
internet
 
or
 
printers.
 
The
 
CSCs
 
are
 
located
 
throughout
 
the
 
nation
 
and
 
only
 
charge
 
a
 
small
 
fee
 
for
 
their
 
services.
 
In
 
India,
 
there
 
are
 
over
 
2,50,000
 
CSCs
 
and
 
these
 
are
 
still
 
increasing
 
for
 
students'
 
convenience.
 
Visit
 
the
 
website
 
-
 
www.csc.gov.in
 
-
 
to
 
find
 
the
 
closest
 
CSC
 
near
 
you.
  The  information  on  charges  &  fees  of  CSCs  for  downloading  the  NEET  Admit  Card  for  2026  is  provided  in  the  table  
below.
  
Services  Fee  
NEET  Application  Form  INR  25/-  
Fee  (Online)  0.5  per  cent  of  the  transaction  value  
Admit  Card  Download  INR  10/-  
Print  out  INR  5/-

metadata.title: All-in-One NEET 2025 Guide: From Syllabus to Strategy

page_content:
Fee  (Online)  0.5  per  cent  of  the  transaction  value  
Admit  Card  Download  INR  10/-  
Print  out  INR  5/-   
Exam  Centre  NEET  Exam  Centres  provide  candidates  with  the  location  for  the  medical  entrance  exam.  There  are  552  
exam
 
cities
 
in
 
India
 
and
 
14
 
international
 
cities
 
to
 
choose
 
from.
 
During
 
the
 
application
 
process,
 
candidates
 
can
 
select
 
up
 
to
 
three
 
preferred
 
exam
 
cities.
 
It's
 
important
 
to
 
note
 
that
 
the
 
choice
 
of
 
NEET
 
exam
 
Centres
 
is
 
limited
 
to
 
the
 
candidate's
 
permanent
 
and
 
present
 
address
 
state.
 NTA  has  revised  the  city  selection  process  for  the  NEET  UG  2026  exam  centres.   Key  Changes:  ●  Aspirants  can  now  choose  three  cities  instead  of  two.  ●  The  number  of  NEET  UG  2026  examination  centres  has  been  reduced  in  the  country.  The  number  
of
 
examination
 
centres
 
for
 
NEET
 
UG
 
2026
 
is
 
552
 
now
 
(last
 
year
 
there

metadata.creator: PyPDF
metadata.title: All-in-One NEET 2025 Guide: From Syllabus to Strategy

page_content:
of
 
examination
 
centres
 
for
 
NEET
 
UG
 
2026
 
is
 
552
 
now
 
(last
 
year
 
there
 
were
 
557
 
centers).
 
 ●  Aspirants  can  select  the  examination  cities  from  within  the  state  of  their  permanent/present  
address.
 ●  If  the  number  of  aspirants  at  the  selected  examination  centre  with  a  regional  language  is  not  
sufficient,
 
NTA
 
can
 
assign
 
examination
 
centres
 
in
 
cities
 
not
 
selected
 
by
 
the
 
aspirants.
 ●  NTA  has  increased  the  examination  centre  opening  time  to  3  hours  before  the  exam.    Exam  Centres  by  Language  Preferences  When  applying  for  the  NEET  2026  exam,  candidates  can  choose  their  preferred  language.  They  have  
several
 
language
 
options
 
to
 
pick
 
from
 
during
 
the
 
online
 
application
 
process.
  
Medium  of  Question  Paper  Examination  Centres  
English  All  Examination  Centres

metadata.creator: PyPDF
metadata.title: All-in-One NEET 2025 Guide: From Syllabus to Strategy

page_content:
Exam  Day  Guidelines  Guidelines  to  remember  at  the  Exam  Centres:  ●  The  exam  Centre  will  open  at  11:00  am,  3  hours  before  the  exam.  ●  Remember,  there  is  no  entry  allowed  after  1:30  pm,  so  try  to  arrive  early.  ●  Essential  items  to  carry  include  your  NEET  2026  Admit  Card,  a  proforma  with  a  postcard-sized  
photo
 
attached,
 
and
 
extra
 
passport-sized
 
photos
 
for
 
the
 
attendance
 
sheet.
 ●  You  must  have  your  Admit  Card  with  you;  without  it,  you  won't  be  allowed  to  enter  the  exam  
Centre.
 ●  It's  important  to  follow  the  instructions  mentioned  in  your  admit  card  and  maintain  discipline  
inside
 
the
 
exam
 
hall.
 ●  Be  prepared  to  handle  your  personal  belongings  as  the  exam  Centre  may  not  provide  storage  for  
bags,
 
etc.
 
English,  Hindi;  Urdu  All  Examination  Centres  in  India  
English,  Hindi  and  Assamese;  Urdu  Examination  Centres  in  Assam

●  Ensure  you  adhere  to  the  dress  code  outlined  in  the  NEET  Information  Bulletin,  which  can  be  
found
 
on
 
the
 
official
 
NEET
 
website.
 ●  Check  the  roll  number  on  your  seat  to  verify  that  it  matches  the  one  on  your  admit  card.      
 NEET  Result  The  National  Testing  Agency  (NTA)  releases  the  NEET-UG  Result  on  its  official  website.  Students  can  
download
 
their
 
scorecards
 
by
 
following
 
the
 
step-by-step
 
instructions:
  ●  Visit  the  official  NTA  NEET  website  to  check  the  results.  ●  On  the  screen,  you  will  see  a  tab  labeled  'View  NEET  UG  Result.'  Click  on  this  tab.  ●  Provide  the  necessary  information,  including  your  Application  Number,  Date  of  Birth,  Candidate  
Email
 
or
 
Candidate
 
Mobile
 
No.
 
and
 
the
 
Security
 
Pin
 
available
 
on
 
the
 
page.

Email
 
or
 
Candidate
 
Mobile
 
No.
 
and
 
the
 
Security
 
Pin
 
available
 
on
 
the
 
page.
 ●  Your  NEET  Score  Card  will  be  displayed  on  the  screen.  ●  To  download  the  NEET  Exam  Result,  click  on  the  'Print'  tab,  and  save  the  file.  ●  Candidates  must  retain  a  copy  of  their  NEET  results  until  the  admission  process  is  complete.  ●  There  is  also  an  option  to  obtain  your  result  using  a  Name  Wise  search.  In  this  case,  you  should  
click
 
on
 
the
 
'NEET
 
Result
 
Name
 
Wise'
 
link.
 Note:  A  scorecard  will  be  required  further  in  the  counselling  process.   
Reservation  criteria  Reservation  Criteria  for  85%  State  Quota  Seats  ●  A  Merit  List  will  be  published,  and  85%  of  seats  under  the  state  quota  will  be  filled  through  
individual
 
state/Union
 
Territory
 
Counselling
 
processes.

metadata.creator: PyPDF
metadata.title: All-in-One NEET 2025 Guide: From Syllabus to Strategy

page_content:
individual
 
state/Union
 
Territory
 
Counselling
 
processes.
 ●  Each  state/Union  Territory  will  conduct  its  own  counselling  to  facilitate  admissions  under  the  
85%
 
State
 
Quota.
 Reservation  Criteria  for  15%  All  India  Quota  (AIQ)  Seats  ●  For  15%  All  India  Quota  Seats,  Indian  Nationals,  NRIs,  OCI,  PIO,  and  Foreign  Nationals  are  
eligible.
 
To
 
take
 
admission
 
via
 
AIQ,
 
candidates
 
must
 
take
 
part
 
in
 
Online
 
Counselling
 
for
 
NEET
 
conducted
 
by
 
MCC.
 ●  Any  remaining  vacant  seats  after  the  conclusion  of  counselling  rounds  for  All  India  Quota  (AIQ)  
will
 
be
 
transferred
 
to
 
State
 
Quota
 
seats.
   Table  showing  the  reservation  break  up  for  SC,  ST,  OBC,  GEN-EWS,  PwD  categories:   Category  Reservation  Percentage  
SC  15%  ST  7.50%  OBC-NCL  27%

metadata.creator: PyPDF
metadata.title: All-in-One NEET 2025 Guide: From Syllabus to Strategy

page_content:
GEN-EWS  10%  PwD  5%   Reservation  for  Economically  Weaker  Sections  (EWS)  The  Ministry  of  Health  and  Family  Welfare  introduced  the  EWS  quota  in  NEET-UG  admissions  in  2019,  
providing
 
10%
 
reservation
 
in
 
jobs
 
and
 
education
 
for
 
candidates
 
falling
 
under
 
this
 
category.
 Eligibility  for  the  NEET  EWS  reservation  is  determined  by  specific  criteria:  ●  Family  annual  income  not  exceeding  ₹8,00,000.  ●  Ownership  of  5  acres  of  agricultural  land  or  more.  ●  Possession  of  a  residential  flat  measuring  1000  sq.  ft.  or  more.  ●  Ownership  of  a  residential  plot  measuring  100  sq.  yards  or  more  in  notified  municipalities.  ●  Ownership  of  a  residential  plot  measuring  200  sq.  yards  or  more  in  areas  other  than  the  notified  
municipalities.
 ●  It's  important  to  note  that  candidates  whose  families  own  any  of  the  mentioned  criteria  will  not  be  
eligible
 
for
 
the
 
EWS

metadata.creator: PyPDF
metadata.title: All-in-One NEET 2025 Guide: From Syllabus to Strategy

page_content:
eligible
 
for
 
the
 
EWS
 
reservation.
  Please  note:  The  above  information  is  based  on  last  year's  trend.   
Counselling  Counseling  details  for  NEET  (National  Eligibility  cum  Entrance  Test)  are  typically  provided  after  the  exam  
results
 
are
 
announced.
 
Once
 
the
 
NEET
 
results
 
are
 
released,
 
the
 
official
 
counseling
 
process,
 
including
 
schedules,
 
procedures,
 
and
 
other
 
details,
 
will
 
be
 
shared
 
by
 
the
 
conducting
 
authorities.

metadata.creator: PyPDF
metadata.title: All-in-One NEET 2025 Guide: From Syllabus to Strategy

page_content:
schedules,
 
procedures,
 
and
 
other
 
details,
 
will
 
be
 
shared
 
by
 
the
 
conducting
 
authorities.
 Here  is  the  counselling  process  for  NEET:   Step  1  –  Sign  Up  as  a  New  User  Step  2  –  Submission  of  Personal  Information  Step  3  –  Pay  the  NEET  Counselling  Fee  Step  4  –  Get  Your  Registration  Confirmation  Step  5  –  Available  Choices  Step  6  –  Pick  your  preference  Step  7  –  Lock  the  Choices  Step  8  –  Print  Confirmation  Step  9  –  Seat  Allotment  Step  10  –  Reporting  to  the  Allotted  College   Documents  Required  For  NEET  Counselling  Below  is  the  list  of  the  documents  required  for  the  counselling  process:   ●  NEET  Admit  Card  issued  by  NTA  ●  NEET  Seat  Allotment  Letter  Issued  by  MCC  ●  Date  of  Birth  Certificate  (if  Matric  Certificate  does  not  bear  the  same)  ●  NEET  Result/Rank  Letter  Issued  by  NTA  ●  Class  X  Certificate  and  Marksheet  ●  Class  XII  Certificate

metadata.creator: PyPDF
metadata.title: All-in-One NEET 2025 Guide: From Syllabus to Strategy

page_content:
●  8  Passport  Size  Photographs  (Same  as  the  one  affixed  on  the  application  form)  ●  Identity  Proof  (Aadhar/PAN/Passport/Driving  License)   NRI  candidates  are  required  to  provide  the  following  essential  documentation:  ●  A  copy  of  the  sponsor  passport  along  with  an  embassy  certificate.  ●  A  sponsorship  affidavit,  confirming  the  sponsorer's  commitment  to  covering  all  study  expenses  
throughout
 
the
 
entire
 
duration
 
of
 
the
 
program.
 ●  An  affidavit  detailing  the  relationship  between  the  candidate  and  the  sponsorer.  Additional  details  (if  any)  will  be  communicated  after  the  official  announcement.   
Preparation  Tips   Here  are  some  valuable  tips  for  preparation  of  the  NEET  exam  collected  from  toppers  and  subject  experts,  
which
 
you
 
can
 
follow
 
to
 
enhance
 
your
 
readiness
 
for
 
the
 
exam.

metadata.creator: PyPDF
metadata.title: All-in-One NEET 2025 Guide: From Syllabus to Strategy

page_content:
which
 
you
 
can
 
follow
 
to
 
enhance
 
your
 
readiness
 
for
 
the
 
exam.
  ●  Familiarize  with  the  syllabus  ●  Invest  In  Good  Quality  Study  Materials  ●  Create  a  Certain  Strategy  and  Follow   ●  Finish  the  Most  Important  Topics  First  ●  Create  and  Stick  To  a  Timetable  ●  Make  your  Own  Notes  ●  Take  Breaks  Regularly  ●  Practice  Mock  Tests  ●  Revise,  Revise,  Revise.  ●  Maintain  a  Healthy  Lifestyle   
Top  Medical  Colleges  The  Ministry  of  Human  Resource  Development  (MHRD)  in  India  releases  the  National  Institutional  Ranking  
Framework
 
(NIRF)
 
rankings,
 
which
 
evaluate
 
educational
 
institutions
 
based
 
on
 
various
 
critical
 
criteria
 
such
 
as
 
infrastructure,
 
faculty
 
quality,
 
placement
 
opportunities,
 
academic
 
excellence,
 
and
 
more.
